lines.text: [the killer is crushed to death in a garbage truck]
He died a fitting end for the garbage he was.

Good day, are you Mr. Ramses? I'm Dorothy Fremont. Well, I heard about you from a friend of mine, Annette Dupree. I'm giving a dinner party in two weeks for my daughter, and Mrs. Dupree says that you cater to just about the type of thing I'm looking for. I want something ususal, something totally different.
Yes, Mrs. Fremont. I do cater to unusual affairs. What do you consider to be unusual?
Oh, I don't know. What do you recommend?
Have you ever had... an Egyptian Feast?
Call the Fremonts, fast! And for Pete's sake, don't let them eat anything!
Do you think we should park here? Do you think it's safe?
On second thought, you might be safer with the killer than you are with me.
Well Frank, it look like one of those long hard ones!
A feast such as this has not been performed in 5,000 years.
Ramses was the killer we've been looking for. Mrs. Fremont, I'm afraid this feast is evidence of murder!
Oh dear! The guests will have to eat hamburgers for dinner tonight.

[voice]
And now, some tragic local news. We have a report of another murder tonight. A young girl has been found dead in Rogers Park. The body was badly mutilated. Because of these murders, the police request that all women stay inside their homes after dark. If you must go out, please have someone accompany you. Keep your door locked.
